links.*: The Lord of the Rings (50th Anniversary Edition)
The Lord of the Rings Online
The Lord of the Rings Online: Shadows of Angmar

wikitext.*:
<noinclude>{{month|February}}
Events that occurred on 14 February.
==On Earth==
</noinclude>
* '''[[1896]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] dictates [[Letter to Arthur Tolkien|a letter to his father]].
* '''[[1896]]''' - [[E.V. Gordon]], a later colleague of Tolkien, is born.
* '''[[1914]]''' - Translator [[Britt G. Hallqvist]] is born.
* '''[[1918]]''' - Producer [[William Lawrence Snyder]] is born.
* '''[[1938]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] gives an invitational speech at the Lovelace Society, the essay club of [[wikipedia:Worcester College, Oxford|Worcester College, Oxford.]] He reads them ''The Legend of Worming Hall'', a story that would become ''[[Farmer Giles of Ham]]''.
* '''[[1977]]''' - ''[[The Mythology of Middle-earth]]'' is published.
* '''[[2008]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]: [[The Lord of the Rings Online: Shadows of Angmar|Shadows of Angmar]]'', "The Ashen Wastes" is released in Europe.
* '''[[2015]]''' - Actor [[Alan Howard]] dies.

==In Arda==
* {{TA|3019}}:
** {{Cal Rest-Company}}<ref group=note>In editions prior to the ''[[The Lord of the Rings (50th Anniversary Edition)|50th Anniversary Edition]]'', the [[Appendix B|Tale of Years]] mentions two events on this day in {{TA|3019}}: [[Gandalf]] returning to life, and the [[Mirror of Galadriel]]-sequence. Since it is clear from the narrative that the latter event occurred one day before departure on [[16 February]], this causes a problem in the chronology. [[Wayne G. Hammond|Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull|Scull]] decided to fix the Tale of Years so that the [[Mirror of Galadriel]]-sequence happened on [[15 February]]. The return to life of Gandalf was also moved to this date, for reasons unclear.</ref>

{{notes}}
